reviewText:
Watching the trailer you might get the impression that this game features gritty and realistic combat, you might even think it looks like a pretty good Battlefield clone and you'd be wrong. Unfortunately the developers have done a really good job of misrepresenting the actual game play. Nothing in the actual game feels gritty or realistic. The enemies all look as if they're made of plastic and likewise their movement is rigid, almost as if they were a plastic toy. Their AI is a huge disappointment, there is no intelligence in their actions. They do the minimum of what is required in order to impede your progress, but that's it.

The weapons all attempt and fail to be futuristic versions of modern weaponry. They sound weak and are extremely inaccurate, which combined with the enemies unintelligent AI and plastic look ends up leaving a very unsatisfied feeling upon killing them.

The single player campaign is short, and contrary to what the developers claim it is also very linear and scripted. At no time during a mission did I ever feel as if I had any real choices as to how I was going to approach any given situation. The drones for example sound like a promising concept, but they fall short. It's almost as if they could have given a person a choice in how to fight or accomplish a given task. In reality though they never felt truly useful because they lack any real use on the battlefield outside of several scripted/forced events, this results in them feeling as if they're nothing more than a prop on a stage.

Most of the maps are large and a couple of them are okay in their design, I almost enjoyed playing them, unfortunately though they're over shadowed by the games numerous shortcomings.

No matter how low the price may be, I can not recommend it. Save your money and time.

reviewText:
This is a fun game.

It ain't Battlefield, though it certainly tries very hard. Bad news first: Servers are down, you won't find anyone to play with online. Thankfully, the single player mode has a lot to offer. If you're old enough to remember Battlefield 2 and how they said it'd have a single player campaign, I'm pretty sure that's what the designers of that old frigate had in mind when they thought about it, even though it never came through eventually (thanks for that, Obama!).

Graphics are still decent, weapons are neat, vehicles rock. The little boondoggle drones keep ingame monotony down. The story is surprsingly well written. I really liked how much thought went into all that just-slightly-beyond-tomorrow-tech - the experience is similar to the recent 2020-future Cowadooties, though far less spectacular, of course. Still, the designer's artistic achievement is to be applauded, if Call of Duty Advanced Blabla comes up with pretty much the same ideas five years later.

Naturally, the immersive aspect is rather reduced when compared to a big-budget game like Battlefield. Often you'll find yourself just blasting at simpleton foes or hammering away at a distant installation with and IFV chaingun. Nonetheless, I was playing through this game with a big grin on my face, if only because it actually felt like a good old GAME instead of these new overscripted pseudo-movies. I'd give the single player experience a straight 8/10, though that number drops significantly after the first pass.

Like I said, a real fun game. Definitely recommended when on sale, you won't regret the four hours or so it takes to  finish. After that, go for two double cheeseburgers at Mickey D's and feel like you're 15 again and all's well with the world for about an hour.

They will never accomplish much other than blocking your line of fire because they appear to not understand objectives and since they don't die they never do things like hold a postion while you flank because the second the bots find a path to you they simply run forward and wherever you're emerging from becomes the front line.

My advice: play Unreal Tournament on assualt maps. There's no poorly written story but the bots feel like actual members of your team and are actually working to acheive the same objective you are rather than just being placeholders to make you feel less alone.

reviewText:
Watching the trailer you might get the impression that this game features gritty and realistic combat, you might even think it looks like a pretty good Battlefield clone and you'd be wrong. Unfortunately the developers have done a really good job of misrepresenting the actual game play. Nothing in the actual game feels gritty or realistic. The enemies all look as if they're made of plastic and likewise their movement is rigid, almost as if they were a plastic toy. Their AI is a huge disappointment, there is no intelligence in their actions. They do the minimum of what is required in order to impede your progress, but that's it.

The weapons all attempt and fail to be futuristic versions of modern weaponry. They sound weak and are extremely inaccurate, which combined with the enemies unintelligent AI and plastic look ends up leaving a very unsatisfied feeling upon killing them.

The single player campaign is short, and contrary to what the developers claim it is also very linear and scripted. At no time during a mission did I ever feel as if I had any real choices as to how I was going to approach any given situation. The drones for example sound like a promising concept, but they fall short. It's almost as if they could have given a person a choice in how to fight or accomplish a given task. In reality though they never felt truly useful because they lack any real use on the battlefield outside of several scripted/forced events, this results in them feeling as if they're nothing more than a prop on a stage.

Most of the maps are large and a couple of them are okay in their design, I almost enjoyed playing them, unfortunately though they're over shadowed by the games numerous shortcomings.

No matter how low the price may be, I can not recommend it. Save your money and time.

reviewText:
I'm not even going to knock the game for needing two legacy drivers (audio and video) because the issues are so well documented that it only took a few minutes to fix. I will, however, say that I can't recommend this game to anyone.

It's not poorly made. The graphics are well made for it's time and everything functions as it should. Unfortunately the gameplay is entirely inferior to those who have come before it. Single player consists of a series of Call of Duty style narrative maps with the addition of a squad of bots to help you against the enemy. Unfortunately the boys are invulerable and not terribly helpful. They will never accomplish much other than blocking your line of fire because they appear to not understand objectives and since they don't die they never do things like hold a postion while you flank because the second the bots find a path to you they simply run forward and wherever you're emerging from becomes the front line.

My advice: play Unreal Tournament on assualt maps. There's no poorly written story but the bots feel like actual members of your team and are actually working to acheive the same objective you are rather than just being placeholders to make you feel less alone.

reviewText:
Avoid this game. I got it just for 3$ in a steam sale and still regret buying it. The game is trying to take aspects of Battlefield like large maps, vehicles and such but fails miserably. Even some of the single player maps are redone multiplayer maps with the only objective being to capture points rather than have any meaningful single player objectives.

Pros
+ The weapon technology is fun to fiddle around with
+ The fight over fuel story had some promise.
+ The game is short so you will be done with it soon enough

Cons
- Boring single player campaign objectives and difficulty.
- Getting shot at from random directions.
- Guns feel pretty flat. Only the sniper had some kick behind it,

I ended up steeling myself and finishing the game but I don't intend to ever play this again. I would only recommend this game for those wanting a quick FPS campaign runthrough if you get it for real cheap in a sale. Otherwise, cannot recommend!
